title: Khorsabad Palace F
description: The armory (ekal māšarti) of Dūr-Šarrukīn (modern Khorsabad) was located in the lower city, adjacent to the southern stretch of the southwest wall. No inscriptions of the eighth-century-BC Assyrian king Sargon II (r. 721–705 BC) record the construction of "Palace F," although several objects of that ruler were discovered there.

properties.description: Representative point of the visible ruins of Palace F, the armory of Dūr-Šarrukīn.
properties.title: Representative location of Palace F
